filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_Can you trust ancestry DNA kits_.json

chunks.chunk_text: Hello. This is 6 Minute English from BBC Learning English. I'm Neil. And I'm Beth.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_Can you trust ancestry DNA kits_.json

chunks.chunk_text: Well, I'm lucky to have an unusual surname, so it's quite easy to trace my ancestors. And somebody in my family has gone back to 1700 and found somebody with my name.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_Can you trust ancestry DNA kits_.json

chunks.chunk_text: DNA is the cellular information that's passed down from parents to children, telling the body how to create life.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_Can you trust ancestry DNA kits_.json

chunks.chunk_text: Not so long ago, I sent off a home DNA testing kit and the results that came back were broadly in line with expectations, but it had some little glitches in there which made me think, is this accurate or is it to be taken with a pinch of salt?
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_Can you trust ancestry DNA kits_.json

chunks.chunk_text: An idiom meaning to doubt something is completely true. So, in this programme, we'll discuss how accurate DNA ancestry tracing is and, as usual, we'll learn some useful new words and phrases. And remember, you can find all the vocabulary for this programme on our website, bbclearningenglish.com.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_Can you trust ancestry DNA kits_.json
RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_Can you trust ancestry DNA kits_.json

chunks.chunk_text: We'll find out the answer later in the programme. Another problem for research based on DNA is agreeing on the meaning of words like ancestry and ethnicity. Here, genealogist Louise Boldock explains the difference between these words to BBC Radio 4 programme Sliced Bread.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_Can you trust ancestry DNA kits_.json

chunks.chunk_text: Like ancestors, the term forebears means actual people, the relatives in your family from a long time ago. But Louise is more interested in the term ethnicity, the shared culture, language and traditions of a group of people, and this is closely connected to a geographical location.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_Can you trust ancestry DNA kits_.json

chunks.chunk_text: The results from the first company matched what he already knew about his family, that the past five generations came from England. But listen to what happens when Louise Boldock revealed the results of Greg's second DNA test on his BBC Radio 4 show Sliced Bread.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_Can you trust ancestry DNA kits_.json

chunks.chunk_text: The second company's DNA test blows Greg's mind. It makes him very excited and surprised. There's no evidence of his ancestors being English at all.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_Can you trust ancestry DNA kits_.json

chunks.chunk_text: On a computer basis, it's not too surprising that Greg's results were so different, unlike his actual DNA. Speaking of which, what was the answer to your question, Neil? I asked you what percentage of human DNA is shared by everyone. And what was your answer, Beth? I said 99.9%. Well, you must be very clever because the answer is correct. Well done. Right, let's recap the vocabulary we've learned starting with family tree.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_Can you trust ancestry DNA kits_.json

chunks.chunk_text: Ancestry refers to the origins of a family. If you take something with a pinch of salt, you don't believe it's completely true. Ethnicity means the social, cultural and linguistic characteristics shared by a group of people. And finally, if something blows your mind, it makes you excited or surprised. Once again, our six minutes are up. But why not head over to the BBC Learning English website
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_Can you trust ancestry DNA kits_.json

chunks.chunk_text: where you'll find a worksheet and quiz, especially for this programme. See you there soon! Goodbye!
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_Can you trust ancestry DNA kits_.json

chunks.chunk_text: or follow the link in the notes for this programme
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_Can you trust ancestry DNA kits_.json
